trans-unit.source: Use MySQL Database on Azure to configure WordPress websites – Azure cloud
trans-unit.target: Use MySQL Database on Azure to configure WordPress websites – Azure cloud

trans-unit.source: WordPress is a very widely used CMS.
trans-unit.target: WordPress is a very widely used CMS.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to use MySQL Database on Azure and Azure Web Apps to install and configure WordPress.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to use MySQL Database on Azure and Azure Web Apps to install and configure WordPress.

trans-unit.source: Use MySQL Database on Azure to configure WordPress websites
trans-unit.target: Use MySQL Database on Azure to configure WordPress websites

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Chinese Version
trans-unit.target: Chinese Version

trans-unit.source: English Version
trans-unit.target: English Version

trans-unit.source: WordPress is a very widely used CMS.
trans-unit.target: WordPress is a very widely used CMS.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to use MySQL Database on Azure and Azure Web Apps to install and configure WordPress.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to use MySQL Database on Azure and Azure Web Apps to install and configure WordPress.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Download the latest version of the WordPress installation package
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Download the latest version of the WordPress installation package

trans-unit.source: Download the latest version of the installation package to your local storage directory from [the official WordPress website](https://wordpress.org/download).
trans-unit.target: Download the latest version of the installation package to your local storage directory from [the official WordPress website](https://wordpress.org/download).

trans-unit.source: You can then extract it to this directory.
trans-unit.target: You can then extract it to this directory.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create a MySQL Database on the Azure server
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create a MySQL Database on the Azure server

trans-unit.source: Use the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.cn) to create your MySQL server.
trans-unit.target: Use the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.cn) to create your MySQL server.

trans-unit.source: Creating MySQL Servers
trans-unit.target: Creating MySQL Servers

trans-unit.source: **Ensure** that the allowed services are already set to “Yes” in your “configuration”; otherwise, this may cause the deployment to fail.
trans-unit.target: **Ensure** that the allowed services are already set to “Yes” in your “configuration”; otherwise, this may cause the deployment to fail.

trans-unit.source: The image below shows that allowed services are set to “Yes” by default.
trans-unit.target: The image below shows that allowed services are set to “Yes” by default.

trans-unit.source: Allowed Services
trans-unit.target: Allowed Services

trans-unit.source: Create a new MySQL database for WordPress to use (essential)
trans-unit.target: Create a new MySQL database for WordPress to use (essential)

trans-unit.source: Switch the workspace to “database,” and click “Create” at the bottom of the screen to create the new database.
trans-unit.target: Switch the workspace to “database,” and click “Create” at the bottom of the screen to create the new database.

trans-unit.source: Creating New Databases
trans-unit.target: Creating New Databases

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Users must manually create the MySQL database in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Users must manually create the MySQL database in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The WordPress deployment will fail if you miss this step.**
trans-unit.target: The WordPress deployment will fail if you miss this step.**

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Create a new web app
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Create a new web app

trans-unit.source: See [How to create and deploy web apps](/documentation/articles/web-sites-php-web-site-gallery) for details of this process.
trans-unit.target: See [How to create and deploy web apps](/documentation/articles/web-sites-php-web-site-gallery) for details of this process.

trans-unit.source: Creating New Web Apps
trans-unit.target: Creating New Web Apps

trans-unit.source: Deploy the WordPress installation files
trans-unit.target: Deploy the WordPress installation files

trans-unit.source: Next, deploy all the WordPress installation files you uncompressed in Step 1 to the new web app.
trans-unit.target: Next, deploy all the WordPress installation files you uncompressed in Step 1 to the new web app.

trans-unit.source: At this point, we recommend that you use Git to complete the deployment process.
trans-unit.target: At this point, we recommend that you use Git to complete the deployment process.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [Publishing to Azure websites from source control](/documentation/articles/web-sites-publish-source-control) for the specific method.
trans-unit.target: Refer to [Publishing to Azure websites from source control](/documentation/articles/web-sites-publish-source-control) for the specific method.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Step 3 is chiefly intended for new WordPress users.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Step 3 is chiefly intended for new WordPress users.

trans-unit.source: Some of you have already used Azure Web Apps and successfully deployed the WordPress installation files and begun using them.
trans-unit.target: Some of you have already used Azure Web Apps and successfully deployed the WordPress installation files and begun using them.

trans-unit.source: To keep the content consistent, we recommend that you export the data and then reimport it after you reinstall and deploy WordPress and successfully connect to a new MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: To keep the content consistent, we recommend that you export the data and then reimport it after you reinstall and deploy WordPress and successfully connect to a new MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: Complete the specific WordPress data import and export procedures by using the WordPress control panel (as shown in the image below).
trans-unit.target: Complete the specific WordPress data import and export procedures by using the WordPress control panel (as shown in the image below).

trans-unit.source: Importing and Exporting With WordPress
trans-unit.target: Importing and Exporting With WordPress

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Install and configure WordPress
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Install and configure WordPress

trans-unit.source: Access and deploy the web app
trans-unit.target: Access and deploy the web app

trans-unit.source: In order to access the web app you created earlier, go to the WordPress configuration page and select the required language.
trans-unit.target: In order to access the web app you created earlier, go to the WordPress configuration page and select the required language.

trans-unit.source: The content in the image below will then appear on the screen.
trans-unit.target: The content in the image below will then appear on the screen.

trans-unit.source: Configuring WordPress
trans-unit.target: Configuring WordPress

trans-unit.source: Connect and configure the MySQL database
trans-unit.target: Connect and configure the MySQL database

trans-unit.source: Enter the configuration details for the database created in Step 2 into the interface shown in the image below.
trans-unit.target: Enter the configuration details for the database created in Step 2 into the interface shown in the image below.

trans-unit.source: Connecting to WordPress
trans-unit.target: Connecting to WordPress

trans-unit.source: If you see what appears in the image below, WordPress is now connected to MySQL.
trans-unit.target: If you see what appears in the image below, WordPress is now connected to MySQL.

trans-unit.source: Successfully Connected to WordPress
trans-unit.target: Successfully Connected to WordPress

trans-unit.source: Click to proceed with the installation, and finish deploying WordPress.
trans-unit.target: Click to proceed with the installation, and finish deploying WordPress.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Use WordPress
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Use WordPress

trans-unit.source: Once you have completed the process above, if you access the web app that you created earlier, you will find that the main WordPress interface now works.
trans-unit.target: Once you have completed the process above, if you access the web app that you created earlier, you will find that the main WordPress interface now works.

trans-unit.source: You are ready to start using WordPress.
trans-unit.target: You are ready to start using WordPress.

trans-unit.source: Installing WordPress
trans-unit.target: Installing WordPress
